body_html:
If that's helpful, I needed the derivative of the matrix exponential some time ago for a non tensor flow-based project and tried a few algorithms (including the one in theano but also some more generic ones). The simple scipy-based test code is available here: https://gist.github.com/tvercaut/61832fd5af87d0278475d01d40860d82

I found the approach of Najfeld to work well for my small scale problem:

Najfeld and T. F. Havel, “Derivatives of the matrix exponential and their computation,” Advances in Applied Mathematics, vol. 16, no. 3, 1995. [Online]. Available http: //dx.doi.org/10.1006/aama.1995.1017

As per the discussion in Theano/Theano#3998, a Taylor expansion is needed in some cases to avoid a division by zero.
